conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have height and thickness, multiple faces are visible, and an angled/isometric camera exposes interior volumes.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall height/thickness and readable room volumes; good angled view with clean cutaway. Minor simplification/softening at some wall junctions and openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room count and adjacency match (living/dining, kitchen, utility, toilet, bedroom, balcony). Major partition locations and proportions are consistent. Some openings (door/window exact positions/sizes) appear simplified versus the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Key furniture and fixtures present and placed in correct rooms (sofa set, dining table, bed, kitchen counters, toilet/sink). Scales and orientations are generally logical.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is clean and readable with good lighting and minimal artifacts. Materials are consistent; background is clean. Minor ambiguity in window/opening detailing.

detected_errors.description: Door/window openings are present but some exact sizes/placements appear simplified compared to the 2D plan.
Some details (e.g., window representation and a few junction edges) are stylized/simplified, slightly reducing precision readability.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong layout fidelity to the 2D plan, with only minor simplifications in opening details.
